intro: Pomaderris affinis, commonly known as the Grey Box, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its grey-green, papery bark and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in late winter to early spring, which are followed by edible, round, yellow berries. It is often found in dry sclerophyll forests and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils, making it a resilient and hardy species.
